com.cyc.kb.exception

Class KBApiRuntimeException

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Throwable
      • java.lang.Exception
        • java.lang.RuntimeException
          • com.cyc.kb.exception.KBApiRuntimeException
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    KBApiServerSideException, StaleKBObjectException, VariableArityException

    public class KBApiRuntimeException
extends RuntimeException
    Root class for runtime exceptions thrown by the KB API. For now, all UnknownHostExceptions and IOExceptions from OpenCyc API will be wrapped with KBApiRuntimeException. This is because the KB API user is not expected to handle such exceptions.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • rethrowIfCycConnectionException

        public static void rethrowIfCycConnectionException(Throwable thrown)
                                            throws KBApiRuntimeException
        Check if a Throwable is caused by CycConnectionException; if so, re-throw it. There's really no point in swallowing exceptions caused by CycConnectionExceptions; such situations are really outside of the purview of the KB API. This method makes it easy to ensure that they bubble up: just call it on a Throwable, and if a CycConnectionException is the underlying cause; the Throwable will be rethrown as a KBApiRuntimeException. If the Throwable is a KBApiRuntimeException, it will simply be re-thrown. If not, it will be wrapped in a new KBApiRuntimeException.
        Parameters:
        thrown -
        Throws:
        KBApiRuntimeException
